p: The most common laboratory method for the clinical diagnosis of COVID-19 is nucleic acid detection by real time- PCR, which is further confirmed by next generation sequencing [ 15]. WHO approved the first two diagnostic tests for emergency use during the COVID-19 pandemic [ 16]. Both are in vitro diagnostics, the tests are genesig Real-Time PCR Coronavirus and cobasSARS-CoV-2 Qualitative assay for use on the cobasÂ® 6800/8800 Systems [ 17, 18].
